subject: Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
msgSnippet: Thanks for replies. In fact, I used getName() to generate a kind of identifier of which tests have been executed, and so generate reports or stuff like that...
messageBody:
Thanks for replies.

In fact, I used getName() to generate a kind of identifier of which
tests have been executed, and so generate reports or stuff like that...

If I well understand, there is no replacement for this method... I
feel amazing that 100% of previous functionalities are not supported :-(

I have to reinvent the well in order to my tests work as before...

Regards,
Anthony



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lee B" <leeb@...> wrote:
>
> I miss getName() as well. Here's what I use it for: I often have lots
> of log4j logging messages that spew out of various places (test code
> and code-being-tested) and if a test fails while running from eclipse
> (say), the logging can be quite revealing about where the bug is
> (without having to run the test again with the debugger, etc). With
> Junit3, I always overwrote setUp() and did a simple:
>
> System.out.println("*** running test: " + this.getName());
>
> so that I can easily find the logging messages for that test in the
> sometimes rather lengthy log.
>
> Lee
